channel.title: Anyone got a dognzb invite?
channel.description:
nzbmatrix went down and i'm crying like a little girl.. anyone got a dognzb invite I could steal? Cheers.
EDIT: Hmm them and nzb.su have both closed regs and removed all invites due to thinking their next, so I guess I'll have to wait.
Mortally wounded. Seedbox time I guess or back to the good old days of searching without an indexer :D

item.title: Anyone got a dognzb invite?
item.dc:creator: @teh_spede Teh Spede
item.description:
@teh_spede wrote:

Message me with your username for free premium membership on http://nzbx.co

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone got a dognzb invite?
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Teh Spede:

nzbx.co looks promising They are still backfilling so wait a day or two for newest releases.

Nice thanks.

Also looks like nzbs.in is trying to hide their true nature. Now when you go to their site it shows “NewZBurnerS”. The true nature of the site isn’t revealed into you actually log in.

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone got a dognzb invite?
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Wow honestly I think this may have been single handedly the largest blow to usenet in awhile, nzbmatrix made everything so easy. Now the most recent episodes of my shows aren’t even getting onto usenet, having to resort to torrents still.

I don’t know whats going on with NZBs.in

Binsearch is all I’ve got left, it works okay but nowhere near the ease of nzbmatrix.

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone got a dognzb invite?
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

[quote=“mwiebelhaus, post:2, topic:471995”]I agree. NZBmatrix was the place to go and i’m butt hurt over this. If anyone has an invite to a private site I would also be interested.

nzbs.in looks like it might be the new place to go. I think they only started a couple days ago though…[/quote]

nzbs.in is a pretty decent yeah, not sure how new it is but its very slow atm due to the huge influx of usenet users with no ‘home’ now. binsearch.info still works but risky as ever, just be careful what you download there.

Is it possible that a usenet indexer could setup something similar to the Silk Road for downloading NZB's? I haven't used it personally but I heard that it is completely anonymous?

Well tbh the web indexers made usenet too easy and I think simpe APIs like nzbmatrix’s as much as i loved it made it a target for anti-piracy types. There was a time when i grabbed NZBs from IRC bots and back then when the community was much smaller we had much less takedowns.

Main problem for usenet is people like this:
http://www.morganelligroup.com/?page_id=56

Read full topic
